intro: Syrrheonema boukokoense, commonly known as the Boukoko mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Cameroon. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that are typically green or brown in color. Syrrheonema boukokoense is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in the cooler, humid climates of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of interest for botanists studying alpine flora.
